intro: Marcellia dinteri, commonly known as the Dinter's marcellia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in dry, rocky environments and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
